column4: Hey. I'm running Kubuntu 12.04 and I have no sound in WINE. What could be the reason for this? I tried the test sound in winecfg and get nothig
Try running your wine app with "padsp wine /path/to/your/file.exe"
that didnt seem to make a difference
Damn, okay then, not too sure... I'd dig deeper but am tired
In Kubuntu it's an easy fix :) You can remove Pulseaudio. KDE, luckily, doesn't need the damned thing.
If you want the one from the GTK versions of Ubuntu, you can sudo apt-get install software-center
Kubuntu is a GTK-free environment by default so it makes sense why they didn't include that
Well... Canonical decided to drop Kubuntu support (it's still community-supported, but all that non-free stuff that is included in Ubuntu won't be in Kubuntu by default)
oh thats a shame since KDE is way better than GNOME now
I agree, but you can install all those apps, the software store is called "software-center", the music player that comes by default is Banshee I think

yeah i know that. I don't really need it that badly it just seems strange they'd leave out all their money making services like the app store, ubuntu one and the music store etc just because i use a different DE
since you use KDE, have you ever had a big with the system tray exanding way more than it should and taking over the whole panel so i cant see the task manager or clock?
Maybe it's hungry? Did you try feeding it? :P Other than that nope, I haven't, weird issue
